subject: You have won a prize money of
body:
You have won a prize money of £7 000.000.00 (Seven Million Pounds) for
the 2024 Edition Powerball Lottery Compensation. 
contact your claims
manager with details below to expedite the processing on your winning
payment.
NAME: COUNTRY: OCCUPATION: Gender: AGE:PHONE:EMAIL: ADDRESS:
Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Hello Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm thrilled to hear that I have won a prize in the Edition Powerball Lottery! Can you please provide me with more information on how to claim my winnings? I want to make sure everything is done correctly and efficiently.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear Richard,


You are welcome to the Powerball Lottery. We Must congratulate you to be so
lucky to have this Assistance. We are pleased to be at your service.

You have in our possession your sum as received. All verification process
has just been concluded and we are making all necessary arrangement to
schedule your payment this
week, The mother-office will release the fund since the information by the
sender was accurate.

Before we can commerce with the transfer of your fund, you are requested
without delay to Pick the option of transfer you want us to use and take
note of the associated charge.
You are hereby advised to regularize the said transfer by choosing one of
the options below.


OPTION (1) BANK WIRE TRANSFER DOWN TO DESIGNATED BANK ACCOUNT IN YOUR
COUNTRY (FEE OF CHARGES : 1,300 GBP Equivalent to 1,600 USD )


OPTION (2) COURIER CHEQUE DELIVERY VIA FAST COURIER SERVICE DOWN TO YOUR
CONTACT
ADDRESS IN YOUR COUNTRY (FEE OF CHARGES £850 POUNDS  EQUIVALENT TO 1,100
USD )


Select one of the above options and get back to us. Note that your winning
amount is protected by a hard-cover insurance policy which makes it
impossible for us to deduct any amount from it before it is remitted
to you.This is in accordance with article 34b sub-sections 132 of the
International Lottery Regulations as amended in the 1996 constitution, this
is to protect the Prime winners of his /her claims.

Please send your response within the next 48 hrs so that we can proceed
with the transfer/delivery process of your claims winning funds.

We look forward to serving you better. Once again, Congratulations.

Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me regarding the Powerball Lottery. I appreciate your assistance in helping me claim my winnings. I have a few questions before I proceed with selecting an option for the transfer.

1. Can you please provide more details about the bank wire transfer option? How long does it usually take for the funds to be transferred into my designated bank account?

2. For the courier cheque delivery option, how secure is this method? Are there any risks involved in having a physical cheque delivered to my address?

3. Could you also clarify the associated charges for each option? I want to make sure I understand the costs involved before making a decision.

I look forward to your response and appreciate your help in guiding me through this process.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear: Richard,

Thanks for your email message, I have gone through your email and I quite
understand you, as regards to your question, the bank in question that's
handling all online winners of powerball lottery payment is reliance bank
limited london uk.

the winning payment is due to be release into your account in 72 hours
after you complete all their necessary requirement, the bank will set up an
online account for you in your names and have the funds lodged into the
account and forward the details that will enable you have access to your
winning funds, e.g your pin code, account number and bank card all will be
forwarded to you to enable you have access to your winning funds.

Sir, for the courier service, this will take just two working days, and the
courier is special courier services, under fedex courier but very secured
because the parcel is usually insured, should the parcel got missing the
courier company will be held responsible for the cheque, liable to pay the
value of the cheque to the receiver whose name appear to be on the cheque,
at the point of the receiver it is signed and deliver to the claimer.

Sir, regards to your last question to me,i wll advise you to read my
paragraph four and five, in my last email to you.

you are therefore advised to choose which option is best for you to enable
us to proceed with the release of your winning funds.

We look forward to serving you better. Once again Congratulations.

Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Hello Lewis,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate the information you have provided regarding the bank handling the online winners of the Powerball lottery payment. Reliance Bank Limited in London, UK, sounds like a reputable institution.

I understand that once I complete all the necessary requirements, the bank will set up an online account in my name and transfer the funds into it. Could you please provide more details on what these necessary requirements are? I want to make sure I have a clear understanding of the process.

Regarding the courier service, it's good to know that it is a special courier service under FedEx and that the parcel will be insured. Can you explain how this insurance works? What happens if there is any issue with the delivery or if the parcel goes missing?

Lastly, could you please clarify what options I have to proceed with the release of my winning funds? It would be helpful to know what choices are available so that I can make an informed decision.

Thank you again for your assistance. I look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear.  Richard,

Thanks for your urgent response.

Sir, regards to your question, yes the bank will open an online account for
you in your name and send you the details that will enable you access to
the account including the bank card, that will be shipped to your mailing
address you will provide for the bank.

The necessary requirement I told you the bank will demand from you is as
follows.

1) batch number and your winning reference number.
2) any id carrying your full name. e.g drivers license or data page of your
international passport.
3) your full mailing address.
4) any utility bills carrying your full names as it stands on your id that
will be provided by you.

you should bear in mind that your batch number and your winning reference
number are presently with us that will be sent to you prior to the time
bank will demand it for security reasons.

Second option, for the courier shipment, the insurance covers the loss of
the cheque should the cheque get missing prior to the delivery the courier
company will be held responsible for the winning funds, that is why it is
necessary for the cheque to be insured.

I hope all this helps you to understand the proceeds of the banking
institute and the courier services, you are very free to ask any more if
you feel you are still not cleared. looking forward to your urgent response.

Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear Lewis,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate the information you have provided so far. I just have a few more questions to clarify things.

1. Could you please explain what exactly is a batch number and a winning reference number? How are they related to my account?

2. Regarding the identification documents, would a photocopy of my driver's license or passport be sufficient, or do I need to provide the original documents?

3. Can you please confirm if there are any fees or charges associated with opening this online account? If so, what are they and how can I make the payment?

4. You mentioned that the bank card will be shipped to my mailing address. How long does it usually take for the card to arrive once the account is set up?

I apologize for asking so many questions, but I want to make sure I fully understand the process before proceeding. Thank you for your patience.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear: richard,

The batch number and reference numbers are designated to you  online the
day the computer picks your email as a lucky winner of the powerball
lottery.

The identification documents needed from you are photocopy not original,
that has to be scanned to us.

The payment of the online account opening fees is  1,300 GBP Equivalent to
1,600 USD and we shall let you know on how to send it upon your next email.

you should bear in mind that a bank card usually takes 10 working days to
arrive at your mailing address, excluding weekends.

Sir, as soon as the payment is made we shall immediately forward those
details to the bank, so that the bank will open up communication with you,
and they will demand for the reconfirmation of those details we have
forwarded to them from you for them to be sure you are the beneficiary for
them to set up the account immediately and have your funds lodge in the
account and send to you the details that will enable you have access to the
funds.

looking forward to hearing from you.

Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Hello Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm glad to hear that I have been designated as a lucky winner of the Powerball lottery. Can you please provide me with more information about the batch number and reference numbers? I want to make sure everything is in order.

You mentioned that the documents needed from me are photocopies, not originals. Could you clarify what specific documents you require? And once I have scanned and sent them to you, what will be the next steps?

I understand that there will be an online account opening fee. Can you please let me know the exact amount in GBP equivalent to USD? Also, could you explain how I can make this payment?

Lastly, regarding the bank card, how long does it usually take for it to arrive at my mailing address? And once it arrives, what should I do next?

I appreciate your assistance and look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Hello Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm glad to hear that I have been designated as a lucky winner of the Powerball lottery. Can you please provide me with more information about the batch number and reference numbers? I want to make sure everything is in order.

You mentioned that you need photocopies of certain documents from me. Could you please clarify which documents specifically? And once I scan and send them to you, what will be the next steps?

I understand that there are some fees involved in opening the online account. Could you let me know how much it would be in GBP equivalent to USD? Also, can you provide me with the payment instructions so that I can proceed accordingly?

Lastly, could you explain a bit more about the bank card and its arrival time? How long does it usually take for it to reach my mailing address?

I appreciate your assistance and look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
1)Any id carrying your full name. e.g drivers license or data page of your
international passport.
2) Your full mailing address.
3) Any utility bills carrying your full names as it stands on your id that
will be provided by you

The payment of the online account opening fees is  1,300 GBP Equivalent to
1,600 USD and we shall let you know on how to send it upon your next email.

you should bear in mind that a bank card usually takes 10 working days to
arrive at your mailing address, excluding weekends.

Note that we shall let you know how to effect the payment  after providing

looking forward to hearing from you.

Mr.Robert Lewis
Claims Manager

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Hello Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your willingness to share information with me. However, I have a few questions before proceeding.

1. Can you please provide more details about the online account opening fees? How much is the GBP equivalent in USD?

2. Could you explain why my full mailing address and utility bills are required? How will they be used in the account opening process?

3. Is there a specific reason why a bank card is necessary for this account? Are there any alternative options available?

I look forward to your response and further guidance on how to proceed.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear valued winner,

Your details are vital for the establishment of the Premium account. Upon
its creation, you will receive the account login details, granting you
access to your winnings.

Please note that the account opening fee of 1,300 Gbp Equivalent to 1,600
usd.

Furthermore, you have the option to opt for the courier service, “express
delivery option” which typically takes 5 to 7 working days for delivery.
The fee for this service is £1100, equivalent to $1380.

The decision is entirely yours.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Warm regards,
Robert Lewis

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
Dear Robert Lewis,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your message regarding the Premium account and the opportunity to access my winnings. Could you please provide me with more information about the account opening fee? I would like to understand how it is calculated and what it covers.

Additionally, I am interested in learning more about the courier service option for delivery. Could you please explain how it works and what the additional fee covers? How can I be sure that my winnings will be delivered safely and securely?

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: You have won a prize money of
body:
